etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Mineralogy Magazine. From the name of Ernest Rutherford + -ine, after German Rutherfordin

definitions: A uranium-containing mineral occurring typically as yellow fibrous masses formed by alteration of uraninite.

notes.text: Rutherfordine is a uranyl carbonate, UO₂·CO₃. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
